node.title: How I stop manually deploying my site with updated components
node.subtitle: Solving problem by CI / CD
node.description: When I started coding this personal website weeks ago, I was too lazy to setup automatic deployment upon any new changes I made to the site. Soon I found that it was SO STUPID...
node.author: Chris Liu
node.content:
When I started coding this personal website weeks ago, I was too lazy to setup automatic deployment upon any new changes I made to the site. Soon I found that it was SO STUPID to manually run the deploy command every single time I commit new changes to the site. That's why I seek help from Circle CI.
So what is CI / CD ????
CI stands for Continuous Integration. So if I have set up a CI environment for my website, I can ensure the whole project will be built in the same environment and with the same versions of packages whenever I commited my code from anywhere. This can avoid the compatability issue of the update I made with the existing code base. Also, I can setup some tests for my commits acting as a second barrier before actually deploying.CD stands for Continuous Deployment. As you can tell from the words, it just means the server will help you in automatically deploying after all those checking and building in the above steps.
How do I make use of Circle CI ?
So basically I wrote a config.yml file under root folder .circleci.{`# Version of CircleCI version: 2.1 jobs: # Name of the job deploy-site: # Tell CircleCI that I need docker environment docker: # Specify the image I need - image: circleci/node:latest working_directory: ~/my-portfolio steps: - checkout - run: sudo npm install -g gh-pages # Download and cache dependencies to avoid installing package per commit - restore_cache: keys: - dependencies-{{ checksum "package.json" }} # Fallback to using the latest cache if no exact match is found - dependencies- - run: yarn install - save_cache: paths: - node_modules key: dependencies-{{ checksum "package.json" }} - run: yarn run build - run: git config --global user.email chrisliupascal@gmail.com - run: git config --global user.name nighostchris - run: yarn run deploy workflows: main: jobs: - deploy-site general: branches: only: - dev`}I wrote the above .yml by reading some documentation in Circle CI.And then I go to CircleCI...Register an account...Link CircleCI with my Github and push my codeSee if the config works...The reason of the error is that CircleCI needs a deploy key with greater priviledge, which is write access to repository in this case, to deploy the updated built site. So now I went to the project setting page...Click the Authorize with GitHub button...And now I can add a user key with higher priviledge. Run the CircleCI deployment process again...NICE!!! I don't need to worry about deploying my site with updates regularly now and focus on coding new stuffs and writing passages like this one XD. Thanks for reading. See you next time!
